premise: A man in a camouflage jacket pulling a little girl in a light purple jacket with pink beanie on a sled through the snow with an ATV.
hypothesis: A person on an vehicle is pulling along a kid on a sled dressed in winter clothing.
explanation_1: A man is a person.  A little girl is a kid.  The girl is in a light purple jacket with pink beanie which is being dressed in winter clothing.  On a sled is what you would be pulled along on.  He is pulling the sled with is ATV.

premise: People collecting a parachute after landing on the ground.
hypothesis: People grab a chute.
explanation_1: collecting is another way to say grab. chute is a short form of parahcute.

premise: a man jumping from one building to another closeby
hypothesis: A man is jumping from building to building.
explanation_1: If the man was jumping from building to building they would essentially have to be fairly close.

premise: Many people are in an indoor swimming pool and one girl is in the act of jumping in headfirst.
hypothesis: The people are indoors.
explanation_1: if the people are in an indoor swimming pool, then they are indoors.

premise: Child wearing glasses learning to shoot a gun.
hypothesis: There is a child wearing glasses.
explanation_1: Wearing glasses is a safety requirement for learning to shoot a gun.

premise: Three people dancing acrobatically in a subway station, with one girl in a skirt doing a cartwheel over another person bending over.
hypothesis: Three people are performing in a subway station.
explanation_1: Dancing and a cartwheel are performing.

premise: A woman standing by a construction area with a pink umbrella.
hypothesis: People wait outside.
explanation_1: A woman wait outside with a pink umbrella.

premise: A woman in nursing bra in bed asleep with a sleeping baby.
hypothesis: The woman is asleep
explanation_1: People sleep in bed so the woman is asleep in her bed.

premise: A man in a white coat jumps a snowboard.
hypothesis: A man is doing snowboard tricks.
explanation_1: The man on the snowboard is doing tricks.

premise: Women in pink dress with white polka dots standing on stone base shoo-shes those in view.
hypothesis: The women in the pink dress tells people to quiet down.
explanation_1: shoo-shes implies to tell people to quiet down.

premise: A man with glasses is sitting at a dinner table in front of a red and white plates with chopsticks lying on it.
hypothesis: A glasses wearing man is sitting at dinner.
explanation_1: HE HAS GLASSES.

premise: Two men working on a yellow Volkswagen beetle.
hypothesis: Two men worked on a car.
explanation_1: A yellow Volkswagen beetle was worked on.

premise: Man on four wheeler in the air.
hypothesis: A person is airborne.
explanation_1: Airborne also means in the air.

premise: Rodeo riding cowboy trying to keep on a bucking bull in an arena surrounded by rodeo clowns.
hypothesis: A person rides a bull.
explanation_1: A cowboy is a person, and trying to keep on a bull is another way of saying he rides a bull.

premise: Skateboarder in green shirt doing tricks in air.
hypothesis: The skateboarder is performing a trick.
explanation_1: Performing a trick is the same as doing tricks.

premise: A man in a flannel shirt stands next to a wooden wall and a framed drawing of a man in a top hat.
hypothesis: A human standing
explanation_1: A man is a human, and stands next to a wooden wall implies standing.

premise: A blond woman in a beige hat and black shirt, looks behind her, smiling at the camera, with a group of other people talking in the background on a street.
hypothesis: A woman smiles at her husband as he takes her picture.
explanation_1: One cannot assume that the woman is smiling at her husband as he takes her picture.

premise: People in a tent listening to one playing a guitar.
hypothesis: A concert is being held at a summer camp.
explanation_1: People in a tent listening to one playing a guitar may be seen as a concert taking place at a summer camp.

premise: An old grandma is looking at a woman who is holding a large white tub of food in a crowd of people.
hypothesis: The grandma is angry with the woman with the tub.
explanation_1: There could certainly be more than one old grandma looking instead of highlighting there is only one by saying the and there is a range of emotions possible.  Angry would be unlikely.

premise: A man with a nose ring in his nose is brushing his teeth.
hypothesis: A man is looking in the mirror while brushing.
explanation_1: A man with a nose ring in his nose is brushing his teeth does not mean that A man with a nose ring in his nose is brushing his teeth does not imply that he is looking in the mirror while brushing.

premise: A man and a woman share a kiss on the beach.
hypothesis: A married couple renew their wedding vows.
explanation_1: Just because a man and a woman share a kiss doesn't imply married couple and doesn't imply renew their wedding vows.

premise: Two people are singing and dancing in a bar in front of many people
hypothesis: people perform for crowd for first time
explanation_1: IT MAY NOT BE THEIR FIRST TIME.

premise: baseball players playing with kids and adults on a field.
hypothesis: they are playing baseball
explanation_1: Baseball players playing does imply they are playing baseball.

premise: man getting thrown in the air while bull riding
hypothesis: Man getting thrown in the air at a corrida.
explanation_1: Being thrown in the air while riding a bull does not imply being at a corrida.

premise: Three people operating on a person for medical reasons.
hypothesis: Three doctors are operating on the woman's brain.
explanation_1: Not all people are a woman.  Not all operations are on the brain.

premise: three African women in traditional orange costume are gathered in front of a yellow curtain.
hypothesis: Three ladies are waiting to perform for an audience.
explanation_1: Being in front of a curtain doesn't necessarily imply that there is an audience there.

premise: Man is standing on white sand and holding a snowboard.
hypothesis: Preparing for fun
explanation_1: We do not know if this man is preparing for fun or what he plans to do.

premise: A climber in an orange helmet is ascending attached to a rope whilst climbing a rock face.
hypothesis: A world class rock climber at work.
explanation_1: Just because a climber is ascending attached to a rope it does not mean the climber is a world class rock climber.

premise: A man is sitting in a chair and playing the guitar.
hypothesis: A young man sitting in a wicker char and playing an electric guitar.
explanation_1: Not all chairs are wicker chairs. Not all guitars are electric.

premise: Small children enjoy themselves sledding.
hypothesis: The children are sledding in a schoolyard.
explanation_1: Just because children are sledding doesn't mean they are in a schoolyard.

premise: The beard have brown fur.
hypothesis: the fox and bear have brown fur
explanation_1: Sentence 1: The beard have brown fur. Sentence 2: the fox and bear have brown fur

premise: The man with pierced ears is wearing glasses and an orange hat.
hypothesis: The man with pierced ears is a homosexual.
explanation_1: A man with a pierced ears wearing a hat

premise: The back view of a young woman wading into the ocean carrying a blue surfboard.
hypothesis: Don't do that without friends
explanation_1: Surfing in the ocean is an activity that one can do without friends.

premise: Passerby admiring painting at an outdoor art fair.
hypothesis: Passerby are watching actors perform a scene from a play.
explanation_1: Passerby could not be admiring painting if they are watching actors.

premise: a woman is sitting in a marble ledge.
hypothesis: Nobody is sitting
explanation_1: A woman suggests a single person, nobody suggests a group. Also, the woman cannot be sitting if no one is sitting

premise: A shirtless teenage boy in long shorts drops in on a quarter pipe in a skate park.
hypothesis: The teen boy is snowboarding while wearing warm clothes
explanation_1: a shirtless and clothes boy are not same.

premise: A guy on a skateboard does a trick on a ramp while others watch on the other side of the ramp.
hypothesis: A guy on a surfboard rides a wave at a competition.
explanation_1: There is absolutely no way that a guy can be on a skateboard does a trick on a ramp and on a surfboard rides a wave at a competition at the same time.

premise: A boy is performing tricks on his skateboard on top of a ledge with street art on it.
hypothesis: A boy is riding a bike.
explanation_1: The boy can't be riding a bike if he is on his skateboard.

premise: A man is doing a back flip on a beach in front of the ocean.
hypothesis: A man stands still.
explanation_1: A man is either doing a back flip or standing still.

premise: Two soccer players from opposing teams trying to get control of the ball before the other player does.
hypothesis: Football players are partying.
explanation_1: Soccer is not football, and if they are trying to get control of the ball, they are not partying.

premise: A young woman in sweatpants looks behind her while standing near the public toilets.
hypothesis: A young woman in the kitchen.
explanation_1: Answer; Public toilets and kitchen cannot be in the same place.

premise: A man and a little girl in a grassy area are planting a tree while a little boy off to the side is holding a hoe.
hypothesis: A man and a little girl in a grassy area are planting marijuana plants.
explanation_1: marijuana and tree are different things

premise: A woman washes an SUV with pink ribbon sticker on the back.
hypothesis: A man rips off the arm of a stranger.
explanation_1: a woman is different than a man

premise: Someone is in a speed boat on the water.
hypothesis: A person is sleeping in a helicopter.
explanation_1: Speed boat is different than helicopter.

premise: A small child in a SpongeBob outfit is using a mop on a floor.
hypothesis: A child works outside on the house.
explanation_1: Mop on a floor is an action taking place inside, not outside.

premise: A female speaker talks about GlamWiki.
hypothesis: a woman is cooking dinner
explanation_1: Woman is either cooking or talking.

premise: a small group of people sitting together outside.
hypothesis: The people are playing tennis.
explanation_1: Playing tennis and sitting are different actions.

premise: A girl in pink giving another girl a hug.
hypothesis: A girl in pink giving a boy a flower.
explanation_1: A girl is not the same as a boy.
